alert.note: Alert for Dawson; Furnas; Gosper; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 11:39PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Franklin, western Phelps, southwestern Buffalo, eastern Gosper, southeastern Dawson, eastern Furnas and Harlan Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1139 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Overton to 6 miles south of Bertrand to near Stamford. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Alma, Elm Creek, Oxford, Bertrand, Overton, Odessa, Orleans, Loomis, Stamford, Republican City, Atlanta, Naponee and Harlan County Dam. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 238 and 260. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
